fields.name: Urban Green Space Types
fields.description: Classifying different types of urban green spaces, such as parks, gardens, vacant lots, street trees, etc.

fields.name: Biotope Types
fields.description: Classification of different types of urban habitats or biotopes, such as parks, gardens, brownfields, green roofs, etc.

fields.name: Vegetation Structure
fields.description: Characteristics of vegetation in urban areas, including factors like canopy cover, understory density, and vertical stratification.

fields.name: Perceived Sensory Dimensions
fields.description: How urban biodiversity is perceived and experienced by humans through senses like sight, sound, and smell.

fields.name: Species Richness
fields.description: The number of different species present in an urban area, often used as a measure of biodiversity.

fields.name: Habitat Specialists vs. Generalists
fields.description: Distinguishing between species that are specialized for specific urban habitats and those that are more generalist in their habitat requirements.

fields.name: Native vs. Non-native Species
fields.description: Categorizing species as either native to the region or introduced/non-native.

fields.name: Physical/Biophysical Factors
fields.description: Environmental factors like soil quality, water availability, and microclimate that influence urban biodiversity.

fields.name: Socioeconomic Factors
fields.description: The role of socioeconomic factors, like income levels, education, and cultural attitudes, in shaping urban biodiversity patterns.

fields.name: Hierarchical Habitat Classification
fields.description: A systematic way of classifying urban habitats at different spatial scales, from individual patches to larger landscape units.

fields.name: Citizen Science Data
fields.description: Biodiversity data collected by members of the public through citizen science projects and initiatives.

fields.name: Plant Communities
fields.description: Categorizing and studying the diversity of plant species and communities found in urban areas.

fields.name: Ecosystem Types
fields.description: Classifying different types of urban ecosystems, such as wetlands, forests, grasslands, and their associated biodiversity.
